source module

class ifs_etc.etc2d.source.Grid(config)[source]

Bases: object

Generate the xy-grid of the IFU FOV under the instrument configuration.

Parameters

config –

dx

spaxel size in x-direction, unit as arcsec

dy

spaxel size in y-direction, unit as arcsec

nx

the number of elements in xarr

ny

the number of elements in yarr

spaxel_area

dx * dy, unit as arcsec^2

xarr

x-array, unit as integer numbers of 0.2 arcsec

yarr

y-array, unit as integer numbers of 0.2 arcsec

x2d

2d array in x, unit as integer numbers of 0.2 arcsec

y2d

2d array in y, unit as integer numbers of 0.2 arcsec

class ifs_etc.etc2d.source.ModelCube(config)[source]

Bases: object

ifs_etc.etc2d.source.filter_mag(objwave, objflux, filterwave, filterthroughtput, output='mag')[source]

Get AB magnitude in a certain filter.

Parameters

  • objwave – unit as A

  • objflux – unit as erg/s/cm^2/A

  • filterwave – unit as A

  • filterthroughtput – unit as detector signal per photon (use vaccum_pass for space telescope, otherwise select a given airmass)

Returns

AB magnitude in this band

ifs_etc.etc2d.source.get_wavearr(config)[source]
ifs_etc.etc2d.source.normalized(template_wave, template_flux, config)[source]

Scale the spectrum template to the given value.

Parameters

  • template_wave – unit in A

  • template_flux – unit in erg/s/cm^2/A

  • config – the normalization dict: {‘value’, ‘unit’, ‘band’ or ‘wavelength’} the geometry info to generate the 2D surface brightness map

Returns

the scaled spectrum cube.

class ifs_etc.etc2d.source.read_filter(filter_name='')[source]

Bases: object

class ifs_etc.etc2d.source.read_template(isource)[source]

Bases: object

get spectrum template using the input parameters

Parameters

isource (dict, including 3 keys) –

name:

the spectrum filename

redshift:

the redshift applied to the template

ebv:

the extinction applied to the template

wave

the wavelength of the spectrum, redshift applied.

Type

numpy.ndarray, unit in Angstrom

flux

the flux of the spectrum, redshift and extinction considered.

Type

numpy.ndarray, unit in erg/s/cm^2/A
